title: Honoring Roger and Patricia Tanner upon the occasion of their designation for special recognition by The Cypress Hills Local Development Corporation
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE RESOLUTION honoring Roger and Patricia Tanner upon the occa-
sion  of  their designation for special recognition by The Cypress Hills
Local Development Corporation

WHEREAS, Individuals who give of their time and energies and  serve  the
best interests of their communities are an asset beyond remuneration and
cannot be sufficiently extolled; and
  WHEREAS,  Roger  and Patricia Tanner have given not only of their time
and energies but also of their competence, intelligence  and  leadership
and consequently have been designated for special honor; and
  WHEREAS,  This  Legislative  Body  is  justly proud to honor Roger and
Patricia Tanner upon the  occasion  of  their  designation  for  special
recognition  by  The  Cypress  Hills Local Development Corporation at an
event celebrating 25 years of service to their community, to be held  at
Catering  By Dees, Forest Hills, New York on Thursday, December 9, 2010;
and
  WHEREAS, Roger and Patricia Tanner have been called upon to contribute
their time and talents to countless civic and charitable  endeavors  and
have always given of themselves unstintingly; and
  WHEREAS,  Both  Roger  and Patricia Tanner were born in Cypress Hills,
Brooklyn, NY; each of their families  were  members  of  Andrews  United
Methodist  Church  on Richmond Street and were both part of the scouting
and youth programs at the church; the two began  dating  in  their  late
teens and were married in 1962; and
  WHEREAS,  At  age  16  Roger  began working at Werner & Acker, Cypress
Hills Florist and remained there after graduating from Franklin K.  Lane
High  School;  he  continued  his employment and training at the florist
shop, managing and ultimately owning the business; Pat  became  increas-
ingly  involved in the floral business and eventually became a full-time
partner; and
  WHEREAS, As members of  Andrews  United  Methodist  Church  Roger  and
Patricia Tanner also found time to work with the youth groups as well as
the  boy  scouts;  as church members they have served in many capacities
over the years from preparing meals, teaching and serving as trustees of
the church; and
  WHEREAS, In 1982, church leaders, members of the community and of  the
Kiwanis  Club  of  Highland  Park  were  called  together;  they began a
youth/senior program and a not-for-profit agency to oversee the program;
this was the beginning of Cypress Hills  Local  Development  Corporation
(CHLDC); and
  WHEREAS,  A  year later in 1983, CHLDC was incorporated and the Inter-
generational Program began; Roger was named to the  Board  of  Directors
and Patricia served on the youth program committee; at the same time New
York City had opened a Neighborhood Stabilization Office in the communi-
ty  which  offered  training, support and assistance to the CHLDC Board;
and
  WHEREAS, Roger was among a group of board members who  wrote  a  Grant
Proposal  to  New  York State Division of Homes & Community Renewal; the
grant was a success and the organization grew from there; and
  WHEREAS, Roger and Patricia Tanner have  been  delighted  to  see  the
CHLDC  grow over the years; as Board Officers and Members they are proud
of their part in bringing the small program of 1983 into an agency  with
such a remarkable level of success; serving 16 students with a part-time
employee  they  now  have  multiple educational, housing, counseling and
community development programs as partners; the current  staff  of  more
than  100  full-time  and many part-time employees has provided jobs and
services for members of the community; and

  WHEREAS, Until retiring last year Roger and Patricia Tanner's business
provided the flowers of many Cypress Hills residents, as well as employ-
ment opportunities for their children, for students after school  hours,
and other members of the community; and
  WHEREAS,  Roger  and Patricia Tanner have been blessed with two loving
children, Deborah and Thomas, and their spouses, as well as nine  grand-
children  and two great-grandchildren, all of whom feel privileged to be
a part of their lives and rejoice in their achievements; and
  WHEREAS, Throughout the entire period of their  community  service,  a
period of constructive involvement, Roger and Patricia Tanner have stood
constant in dignity, good grace and humor; and
  WHEREAS,  It  is  the sense of this Legislative Body to recognize that
the quality and character of life in the  communities  across  New  York
State  are  reflective  of  the concerned and dedicated efforts of those
organizations and individuals that are devoted to  the  welfare  of  the
community and its citizenry; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor Roger and Patricia Tanner upon the occasion of  their  designation
for  special  recognition  by The Cypress Hills Local Development Corpo-
ration; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Roger and Patricia Tanner.
